properties.areaDesc: Transylvania; Madison; Northern Jackson; Buncombe; Haywood; Swain
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 7 at 9:06AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
A potent short wave trough will continue bring shower activity
across the mountains this morning, lingering into the early
afternoon near the Tennessee border. Steep mid-level lapse rates
will support heavier showers with reduced visibilities at times
with even an isolated thunderstorm or two possible. Snow levels
are expected to remain around 5000 feet, but may briefly drop down
to 4000 feet in heavier bands. An additional dusting to an inch
of snow is possible, mainly above 5000 feet.

Use caution if traveling today across the southern and central
mountains of western North Carolina.

NWSheadline: ADDITIONAL LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE ABOVE 5000 FEET THROUGH EARLY THIS AFTERNOON
